AttackerCapabilities: Ability to craft a valid JWT

Steps.Description: Analyzing the capture, two interesting cookies are discovered: JWT 'identity'=31337 and JWT 'secret'="dawgCTF?heckin#bamboozle".

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that the JWT 'identity' and 'secret' cookies can be used to gain unauthorized access.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a valid JWT with the 'identity' of 31337 and 'secret' of "dawgCTF?heckin#bamboozle" using JWT.io.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker obtains a valid JWT: eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZGVudGl0eSI6MzEzMzcsImlhdCI6MTU4NjU2NDk0NSwibmJmIjoxNTg2NTY0OTQ1LCJleHAiOjE1ODY5MDg4MDB9.Hx0gLrzRZy4lGdEhvVeIpdpSSapd6FQVBy1pMVNPE

Steps.Description: Calling the endpoint with the JWT in the Authorization header will give access to the flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker hypothesizes that using the crafted JWT in the Authorization header will grant access to the flag.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends a GET request to the /jwtlogin endpoint with the crafted JWT in the Authorization header.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully retrieves the flag: DawgCTF{y0ud0wnw!t#_JWT?}
